content: materials 10/12 ply/aran/worsted/bulky 60-80g 4mm hook 5 or 5 5mm hook stitches- scblo - single_crochet in back loop only half_double_crochet- half_double_crochet crossed half_double_crochet stitch https //www mamainastitch com/crossed-half-double-crochet-stitch-tutorial/ video tutorial on my instagram igtv wrist band with small hook chain 9 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and in next 6 chains end chain 1 turn row 2 single_crochet in back loops only across 8 stitches row 3-26 24 or to fit wrist in multiples of 2 if you are using the x stitch single_crochet in back loops only 8 chain 1 turn slip_stitch ends together to form the wrist slip_stitch through front loop only turn your wrist piece right side in chain 1 and twist your piece to face you to crochet your first round of the body section main section basic half_double_crochet pattern row 1 single_crochet in same place as you chained 1 from and single_crochet evenly around 1 single_crochet in top of each rib row 26 24 switch to larger hook row 2-5 4 chain 1 half_double_crochet in same stitch half_double_crochet around slip_stitch to first half_double_crochet right hand glove row 6 5 half_double_crochet around until 5th to last stitch leave 4 stitches unworked chain 4 and join to beginning of round left hand glove row 6 5 half_double_crochet 10 then skip 4 stitches chain 4 this is so that the joining line on the glove is down the palm of the hand and hidden both gloves row 7 6 half_double_crochet around including 4 hdcs in the 4 chain space row 8-10/11 7-8 half_double_crochet around as in row 2-5 4 optional you can work a row of single_crochet as your final row to get the required length for your hands fasten_off crossed stitch pattern follow the basic body pattern but cross your half_double_crochet stitches as follows row 1 same as basic pattern row 2 onwards chain 1 half_double_crochet in the next stitch half_double_crochet back into the first stitch where you chained 1 from skip 1 stitch half_double_crochet into next stitch half_double_crochet back into the stitch you skipped continue around until you have 13 12 crosses or pairs of crossed hdcs row 6 5 when you chain 4 and skip 4 stitches you will skip 5 so that you can cross back to the 5th stitch for your next half_double_crochet row 7 6 when you work your crossed hdcs into the chain 4 space you will need to work them into the chains not the large space created by the chain 4 to ensure you can cross back to the previous chain row 9 work one row of crossed single crochets to add length to your gloves without too much length as with another row of half_double_crochet notes *its up to you how many row you work before and after the thumb hole depending on your hands or the hands you are making for the pattern here
